category: Marketing Regulations/Article 11 (Prohibition of Ambush Marketing, etc.)
contents: Article 11 (Prohibition of ambush marketing, etc.) ① Persons other than commercial rights holders may not use marketing assets for commercial purposes without prior approval of the Sports Council or infringe upon the rights of the Sports Council through any of the following methods. does not exist. 1. Labeling or advertising that causes a person other than a commercial right holder to misunderstand that he or she or a specific product or service is related to a sports association, competition or event, competition or event participant, etc. by linking it or a specific product or service with marketing assets. 2. A person other than a commercial right holder may use the sports association for a fee or free of charge. 3. An act of providing or promising to provide an admission ticket or prize provided as a prize; 3. In addition, in a manner consistent with subparagraphs 1 and 2, causing the misconception that it is related to a sports meeting, competition or event, or participant in a competition or event Act ② Pursuant to Article 54 of the Articles of Incorporation, no one may perform any act corresponding to any subparagraph of Paragraph 1 in relation to Olympic assets without prior approval of the International Olympic Committee or the Sports Council.
